result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of extended supervision or civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with victim, Kristina S.

Successfully complete "Batterer's Intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continue programming.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfullyc omplete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommeded treatment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript EXCERPT OF SENTENCING HEARING (5 pages) commencing AUGUST 25, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
 AS TO COUNT #3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, with credit for 11 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling OR Anger Management, and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Kristina S.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.      mld

Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in court with attorney Lucas Kaster.  Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case recalled.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1 and #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-25-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 The State is prepared to proceed to trial on counts #2 and #3.  Parties are currently in negotiations.  Case passed.   mld
Jury trial scheduled for 07-23-2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case could not be heard on today's date as court is in trial on an unrelated case.

Parties request case be adjourned for trial.  Case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 4.

Attorney Lucas Kaster in court, defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 FILE NOT IN COURT.  Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Defendant has a revocation hearing pending.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-15-2014 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in court with attorney Lucas J Kaster.  Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties advised this case is transfered to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04 due to ADA assignment. 
BRANCH 23 for BRANCH 04
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case adjourned for Scheduling date before branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in court with attorney Lucas J Kaster.  Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson and Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Br. 4 for Br. 23.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Information not available per the State, therefore, case adjourned for Arraignment Hearing in Branch 23 on 2-27-2014 at 1:30  pm.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KRISTINA S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.  Defendant Benjamin H Hernandez-Klitzka in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in BRANCH 4 FOR Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
